name: Zipcode Utility Data 2020
title: Zipcode Utility Data 2020

api_list.name: /utilityName
api_list.description: The 'utilityName' endpoint from the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API provides a helpful list of various utility names related to different areas or regions. These utility names are represented as an array of strings, which means they are presented in a sequential format. This endpoint essentially returns a collection of unique names that correspond to utilities associated with zip codes or specific locations. By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain vital information about utility service providers in different areas. These utility names can include providers for electricity, water, gas, and other essential services. With this endpoint, you can easily access all the possible values for the 'utilityName' field, giving you an understanding of available utility providers. This information can be valuable for anyone researching utility services in specific regions or considering a relocation to a different area.

api_list.name: /indRate
api_list.description: The 'indRate' endpoint from the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API provides an array of strings that represents a field named 'indRate'. This field is associated with individual rates or ratios, which are numerical values that reflect certain measurements or statistics for specific areas or groups. These rates can range from 0 to 1, where 0 indicates the lowest rate and 1 represents the highest rate.The 'indRate' endpoint allows users to access all the possible values for this field within the given range. These values can be utilized for various purposes, such as analyzing trends, making comparisons, or conducting research related to specific areas or demographic groups. By retrieving this information through the API, users can gain insights and draw conclusions about the individual rates associated with different regions or populations.It is important to note that the actual values returned by the 'indRate' endpoint will not necessarily match the examples provided, as those were only given for reference and are not representative of the complete dataset.

api_list.name: /eiaid
api_list.description: The 'eiaid' endpoint from the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API provides a valuable array of strings containing all possible values for the 'eiaid' field. 'eiaid' refers to the Energy Information Administration (EIA) identification number associated with specific utilities or energy providers. This endpoint offers a comprehensive list of these unique identifiers, allowing users to access detailed information about various utilities across different locations. Each 'eiaid' represents a distinct utility company, facilitating efficient data retrieval and analysis related to the energy industry.By utilizing this endpoint, users can obtain invaluable insights into utility providers, such as their service areas, renewable energy initiatives, billing structures, and more. This information can be leveraged by researchers, energy analysts, and policymakers to better understand the energy landscape, compare utility offerings, and make informed decisions regarding energy consumption and management.In summary, the 'eiaid' endpoint from the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API provides an extensive list of 'eiaid' values, offering valuable information about utility providers and supporting various energy-related analyses.

api_list.name: /resRate
api_list.description: The 'resRate' endpoint in the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API provides an array of strings that represent the possible values for the field 'resRate'. The 'resRate' field relates to the residential rate, which is a rate or ratio associated with residential activities in a specific area or zipcode. The values returned by this endpoint indicate the different levels or percentages of residential activity within a particular location.This endpoint is useful for gaining insights into the composition or nature of a given area in terms of residential usage. By analyzing the 'resRate' values, one can understand the proportion of residential properties, households, or residents residing in a specific zipcode. Although specific examples are not mentioned, the range of values for 'resRate' could vary from 0 (indicating no residential activity) to 1 (representing complete residential usage).This API endpoint enables users to access and utilize the 'resRate' data to analyze demographic patterns, understand the distribution of residential areas, or make informed decisions related to real estate, urban planning, or resource allocation based on the residential composition of a particular zipcode.

api_list.name: /ownership
api_list.description: The endpoint 'ownership' from the API 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' provides an array of strings representing different types of ownership for a particular entity. This endpoint allows users to access all the possible values for the 'ownership' field. In simpler terms, when you use this endpoint, it returns a list of different categories that describe who owns a specific thing or entity. For example, the ownership of something could be classified as federal, meaning it is owned by the government at a national level. Another possible value could be cooperative, indicating that the ownership is shared among a group of people who work together for a common goal.By utilizing this endpoint, developers or users of the API can easily gather all the potential ownership types available. This information can prove valuable in various applications, including analyzing ownership patterns, categorizing businesses or organizations, or understanding the dynamics of different industries.

api_list.name: /state
api_list.description: The 'state' endpoint of the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API provides a range of options for the field 'state' in a user-friendly manner. The response from this endpoint is an array of strings representing the possible values for the 'state' field. Each string in the array represents the abbreviation of a specific state. For example, if you are looking for all the states in the United States, the 'state' endpoint will return options like CA for California, NY for New York, TX for Texas, and so on.By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve a comprehensive list of available state options. Whether you need this information for address validation, organizing geographical data, or any other geographic-based operations, the 'state' endpoint allows you to fetch all the possible values efficiently. This way, you can ensure accurate and standardized data related to states within your applications or databases.

api_list.name: /serviceType
api_list.description: The 'serviceType' endpoint from the API 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' provides a user-friendly way to obtain all the possible values for the 'serviceType' field. It returns an array of strings, which means it gives you a list of different categories or types of services available. These service types could include things like internet service, cable TV, phone service, or other utility services offered in specific areas.By accessing this endpoint, you can easily retrieve a comprehensive list of service types that are available for a given zipcode or region. This information can be helpful for users who want to understand the range of services they can expect to find in a particular location. It allows you to make informed decisions about utilities and services based on the available options.Overall, the 'serviceType' endpoint simplifies the process of exploring and understanding the types of services offered in different areas, enabling users to quickly discover and compare utility options based on their needs and preferences.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint from the API 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' provides a convenient way to retrieve an array of strings representing the possible values for the 'dataListIndex' field. These strings are unique identifiers associated with various data lists within the API. By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain a comprehensive list of available 'dataListIndex' values.These values serve as references or codes used to categorize and organize data in the API. Each 'dataListIndex' corresponds to a specific dataset or information category, allowing users to easily identify and retrieve relevant data sets by referring to these identifiers.For example, if a user wants to access information related to population statistics, they can refer to the 'dataListIndex' endpoint to obtain the specific 'dataListIndex' associated with population data. By using this value in subsequent API requests, users can retrieve accurate and up-to-date population information.Overall, the 'dataListIndex' endpoint simplifies the process of retrieving valuable data by providing a comprehensive list of available data lists and their corresponding identifiers.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint of the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API is a powerful tool that enables users to retrieve relevant information with ease. By providing specific query parameters, users can obtain an array of objects containing the desired data rows. This endpoint acts as the main gateway to access a wide range of helpful data. Whether you are looking for details about a particular location, postal codes, or utility information, the 'records' endpoint will deliver the specific rows that match your query parameters.Imagine needing to find information on utility services or specific zip codes within a certain area. By making use of the 'records' endpoint, users can swiftly obtain accurate and up-to-date data. This versatile endpoint ensures convenience and precision, providing the necessary information to fulfill numerous objectives. Users can effortlessly extract the exact rows they need, saving time and effort in the process.With the 'records' endpoint, gaining access to vital information is straightforward and user-friendly, empowering users with the knowledge they require for their unique purposes.

api_list.name: /zip
api_list.description: The 'zip' endpoint of the ZipcodeUtilityData2020 API provides a convenient way to retrieve a list of all possible values for the field 'zip'. This endpoint allows you to access an array of strings that represent unique zip codes. A zip code is a numerical code used in postal addresses to identify a specific geographic area for efficient mail sorting and delivery. By making use of the 'zip' endpoint, you can easily obtain a comprehensive list of available zip codes. This information can be valuable for numerous purposes such as validating user input in address forms, performing specific geographic searches, or updating databases with the latest zip code data.

api_list.name: /commRate
api_list.description: The 'commRate' endpoint from the 'ZipcodeUtilityData2020' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve all possible values for the 'commRate' field. 'commRate' stands for commercial rate, which represents the rate of commercial activity in a particular area. When you access this endpoint, it will return an array of strings containing various values for the 'commRate'. These values can range from 0 to 1, and they indicate the level or intensity of commercial activity in a specific location or zipcode. However, it's important to note that the values mentioned in the examples provided (0.06248810874698297, 0.11084059641287906, 0.10955145538412597) are only for illustration purposes and may not be included in the actual response.By utilizing this endpoint, you can gain insights into the commercial landscape of different areas, helping you make informed decisions related to business planning, potential market opportunities, or understanding the economic vitality of different regions.
